sen.j: 鼓月（こげつ）は、京都市伏見区に本社を置く京菓子の製造と販売をする会社。
sen.e: Kogetsu is a Kyo-gashi (Kyoto style confectionary) manufacturing and sales company whose headquarters is located in Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City.
Kogetsu is a Kyo-gashi (Kyoto style confectionary) manufacturing and sales company whose headquarters is located in Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City.
Kogetsu is a Kyo-gashi (Kyoto style confectionary) manufacturing and sales company whose headquarters is located in Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 京菓子處 鼓月として全国の直営店や百貨店に展開している。
sen.e: They deploy their directly-managed stores named Kyogashi-dokoro Kogetsu and also have a number of stores with the same name at department stores throughout the country.
They deploy their directly-managed stores named Kyogashi-dokoro Kogetsu and also have a number of stores with the same name at department stores throughout the country.
They deploy their directly-managed stores named Kyogashi-dokoro Kogetsu and also have a number of stores with the same name at department stores throughout the country.

sen.j: 戦後第二次世界大戦後1945年10月に京都にて創業した。
sen.e: After World War II, this company was established in Kyoto in October 1945.
After World War II, this company was established in Kyoto in October 1945.
After World War II, this company was established in Kyoto in October 1945.

sen.j: 中でも「千寿せんべい」が有名。
sen.e: Senju-Senbei' (Celebratory Sandwich Waffle) is especially well known among their products.
Senju-Senbei' (Celebratory Sandwich Waffle) is especially well known among their products.
Senju-Senbei' (Celebratory Sandwich Waffle) is especially well known among their products.

sen.j: ヴァッフェル生地にバニラクリームが入っている、波型のお菓子である。
sen.e: This is a wavy-shaped vanilla cream sandwich on waffle crackers.
This is a wavy-shaped vanilla cream sandwich on waffle crackers.
This is a wavy-shaped vanilla cream sandwich on waffle crackers.

sen.j: 鼓月の和菓子を提供する甘味処として、現在下記の3店舗を展開している。
sen.e: They currently have the following three tea shops where they provide their Japanese-style sweets.
They currently have the following three tea shops where they provide their Japanese-style sweets.
They currently have the following three tea shops where they provide their Japanese-style sweets.
Sabo (tea shop) Kashin, the Gion store

Sabo Kogetsu, the Arashiyama store
